remarks:
Universal quantification restricted to a Cartesian product is equivalent to a double restricted quantification.  The hypothesis specifies an implicit substitution.  (Contributed by NM, 7-Feb-2004.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.) 

---

 Universal quantification restricted to a cross product is equivalent to a double restricted quantification.  The hypothesis specifies an implicit substitution.  (Contributed by NM, 7-Feb-2004.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.)
statement:
ralxp.1 $e |- ( x = <. y , z >. -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
ralxp $p |- ( A. x e. ( A X. B ) ph <-> A. y e. A A. z e. B ps ) $.
$d A x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d ph y z $.
$d ps x $.
